title: Analysis of Low Signal-to-Noise Atomic Resolution Spectroscopy of Radiation-Induced Sublattice Disorder in Ferritic Superalloys
content: Atomic resolution spectroscopy can provide necessary information about the ordering of elements in a material, but require large acquisition times that may result in damage or accumulation of contamination [1]. Typical lattice-averaging methods [2] can improve signal to noise but may present issues when unit cell sizes or ordering are the object of interest. Here we show an analysis of fast large field of view acquisitions that accounts for different length scales of chemical ordering in pre- and post-irradiated FeNiAlTi alloy samples.
